Text: Private Nursing Homes: Pensioner Patients

Speaker: NA
Text: To the Honourable the Speaker and Members of the House

Speaker: NA
Text: of Representadves assembled. The petiuon of the under-

Speaker: NA
Text: signed citizens of Australia respectfully showeth:

Speaker: NA
Text: That many pensioners who are holders of the Pensioners

Speaker: NA
Text: Health Benefit Card, have suffered undue hardship as

Speaker: NA
Text: inmates of private nursing homes, because the Federal

Speaker: NA
Text: Government subsidy was insufficient to meet the charges

Speaker: NA
Text: laid down.

Speaker: NA
Text: Many pensioners whose spouse was an inmate of the prithe

Speaker: NA
Text: vate nursing homes suffered poverty in an

Speaker: NA
Text: tain their partner while in the nursing home.

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA
Text: very little else to Uve on and are forced to pay high rents,

Speaker: NA
Text: in many cases living in extreme poverty.

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA
Text: tralian Government as a matter of urgency to:

Speaker: NA
Text: (1) Make sure that subsidies paid to private nursing

Speaker: NA
Text: homes are such that each pensioner

Text: Health Benefit Card will pay the private nursing home no

Speaker: NA
Text: more than the statutory minimum padent contribution,

Speaker: NA
Text: patient for their personal use.

Speaker: NA
Text: (2) That a pensioner holding a Pensioner Health Benefit

Speaker: NA
Text: Card shall have a telephone installed free of charge, or at a

Speaker: NA
Text: very nominal charge.

Speaker: NA
Text: (3) That those pensioners who have only their pension

Speaker: NA
Text: and very little else to live on, shall receive a subsidy to assist

Speaker: NA
Text: them. The subsidy to be governed by a means test.

Speaker: NA
Text: And your petitioners as in duty bound will ever pray.

Text: South Africa: Death of Mr Steve Biko

Speaker: NA
Text: To the Honourable the Speaker and Members of the House

Text: of Representatives in Parliament assembled. The humble

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA
Text: South Africa;

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA
Text: sinular circumstances in South Africa in the last 18 months;

Speaker: NA
Text: and the 44th death of a prisoner while in police custody in re-

Speaker: NA
Text: cent years;

Speaker: NA
Text: 22; and had previously been

Speaker: NA
Text: and in addition, was under a five-year house arrest and res-

Speaker: NA
Text: triction order;

Speaker: NA
Text: That Steve Biko is the acknowledged leader ofthe black

Speaker: NA
Text: people's resistance to apartheid, racial exploitation and

Speaker: NA
Text: injustice in South Africa, and

Speaker: NA
Text: the hands of the white police must be regarded with grave

Speaker: NA
Text: suspicion;

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA

Speaker: Mr HURFORD
Text: Adelaide) (3.24)-It is my

Text: lyse the Budget as an economic document The

Text: Fraser Government's pohcies are built on three

Text: this afternoon. The first is the 'short, sharp

Text: shock' thesis. When this has not worked it has

Speaker: NA

Text: week the notification in accordance with regulation 146AD,

Text: NA

Speaker: NA
Text: tember 1977:

Speaker: NA
Text: (1) Has the Canberra College of Advanced Education

Text: purchased a BMW motor car during the last 2 years; if so,

Speaker: NA
Text: what was the purchase price paid and did it include sales tax.

Speaker: NA
Text: by the Principal for official purposes, where is the car

Speaker: NA
Text: garaged.

Speaker: NA

Text: tions of the status ofthe Canberra College of Advanced Edu-

Speaker: Mr VINER
Text: Th e answer to the honourable

Speaker: NA
Text: member's question is as foUows:

Speaker: NA
Text: (1) The Canberra College of Advanced Education has

Speaker: NA
Text: purchased a BMW motor car during the last two years. The

Speaker: NA
Text: price ofthe vehicle was $11,995. The purchase was exempt

Speaker: NA

Speaker: NA
